</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets how much ammunition (compared to the configuration of magazines defined in the vehicle's class) the vehicle has. Note that the ammo will only be added to [[local]] turrets. To check the locality of turret use [[turretLocal]].  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''setVehicleAmmoDef''' value </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]] - Unit or vehicle. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> value: [[Number]] - From 0 (no ammo) to 1 (fully loaded). </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setVehicleAmmoDef]] 0;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

[[Category:Arma_3:_New_Scripting_Commands_List|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 20, 2014 - 21:49 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Actium|Actium]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For vehicles this command operates relative to its stock magazine loadout (i.e. its CfgVehicles magazines[] values). Thus ''setVehicleAmmoDef 1'' will fully restore a vehicle to its default ammunition capacity, resetting any changes made by intentionally/implicitly adding/removing magazines.
Use [[setVehicleAmmo]] to operate in relation to a vehicle's current magazine loadout.
--[[User:Actium|Actium]] ([[User talk:Actium|talk]]) 22:49, 20 December 2014 (CET)
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
